intro: Phyllorkis affinis, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its strap-shaped leaves and showy, yellowish flowers. The plant is typically found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It plays an important role in the local ecosystem and has been used by Māori for traditional purposes. However, it is now considered endangered due to habitat loss and invasive species.
